wikipedia_page.main: George Harcourt RA (1868-1947) was a Scottish portrait and figure painter, known for painting influential members of society.

response: A 1944 portrait of Herbert by the Scottish painter George Harcourt hangs in the Watford Museum, and there are also photographic portraits of Herbert by the high-society portrait photographers Bassano & Vandyk in the collection of the National Portrait Gallery in London.

From 1924 he was a member of the Royal Commission on Lunacy and Mental Disorder  and succeeded Hugh Macmillan, Baron Macmillan as chairman in 1930. The Macmillan Commission established the framework for the Mental Treatment Act 1930 and eventually led the way to the passing of the Mental Health Act 1959 and later Mental Health Acts.The politics of a new Mental Health Act - MONCRIEFF 183 (1): 8 - The British Journal of Psychiatry He was a governor of his old school, Mill Hill for over fifty years, and was sometime chairman of the board of governors. A portrait of Micklem by George Harcourt RAGeorge Harcourt (1868–1947) was unveiled at the school on Foundation Day in 1932.
